title: 107_s1020
content: The Act titled "Medicare Fairness in Reimbursement Act of 2001" aims to improve fairness of payments to providers under the Medicare fee-for-service program by amending Title XVIII of the Social Security Act. The "Medicare Fairness in Reimbursement Act of 2001" establishes a system for adjusting payment amounts to entities and individuals for services under Medicare Parts A and B. The Secretary will make adjustments if a State's average per beneficiary amount exceeds the national average by a certain percentage. The Secretary will adjust payments to states based on their average per beneficiary amount compared to the national average, aiming for 105-110 percent for subsequent years. If a state's amount is below 95-90 percent, payments will be increased accordingly. The Secretary will adjust payments to states based on their average per beneficiary amount compared to the national average, aiming for 95-90 percent for subsequent years. Each year, the Secretary will determine a State average per beneficiary amount for each State based on the average amount of expenditures under the original medicare fee-for-service program. The Secretary will adjust payments to states based on their average per beneficiary amount compared to the national average, aiming for 95-90 percent for subsequent years. The national average per beneficiary amount is determined each year, equal to the average of State average per beneficiary amounts. Definitions include 'applicable payments' for items and services under Medicare parts A and B for beneficiaries in the State. The Secretary will adjust payments to states based on their average per beneficiary amount compared to the national average, aiming for 95-90 percent for subsequent years. Definitions include 'applicable payments' for items and services under Medicare parts A and B for beneficiaries in the State. The provisions of this section shall not affect the entitlement to items and services of a beneficiary under this title, including the scope of such items and services, or any liability of the beneficiary with respect to such items and services. Regulations will be promulgated by the Secretary, in consultation with the Medicare Payment Advisory Commission, with special consideration given to rural areas. The Secretary shall ensure budget neutrality in implementing the provisions of this section. The provisions in this section ensure that expenditures under this title for a year do not increase or decrease compared to what would have been spent if this section had not been enacted. Improving fairness of payments for physicians' services under the Medicare fee-for-service program. The amendment to the Physician Fee Schedule under the Social Security Act includes adjustments to geographic indices, introducing a floor and ceiling on these indices to ensure fairness in payments for physicians' services under Medicare fee-for-service program. The Secretary will adjust the conversion factor to ensure budget neutrality when applying a floor and ceiling on geographic adjustments for Medicare payments. The amendments made by this section will apply to payments for items and services provided on and after January 1, 2002, ensuring that aggregate payments under this part in that year are equal to what would have been made if a specific subsection had not been enacted.
